1.text: Combine the yeast, 8 oz (230 g) of flour, and water in a mixing bowl.

2.text: Add the olive oil, salt, and remaining flour to the bowl.

3.text: Knead the dough for about 6 minutes.

4.text: Sprinkle in 1 to 2 oz (28 to 57 g) of flour if the dough is too sticky.

5.text: Place the dough ball in a greased bowl and cover it.

6.text: Allow the dough to rise for 2 hours.

7.text: Punch down the dough and place it on a floured surface.

8.text: Cut the dough into 8 equal-sized pieces and roll them into balls.

9.text: Let the dough balls rise for 30 minutes.

10.text: Flatten the dough balls into 0.25 in (0.64 cm) thick discs.

11.text: Wrap and refrigerate the dough for up to 1 week.

12.text: Heat 0.5  fl oz (15 mL) of olive oil in a cast iron pan.

13.text: Place 1 of the dough discs into the pan and cook for 30 seconds.

14.text: Flip the disc and cook for 1 to 2 more minutes on the other side.

15.text: Turn the disc over and cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes.

16.text: Remove the cooked pita bread from the heat and place it onto a plate.

17.text: Repeat to cook the rest of the pita bread.

18.text: Eat the pita bread immediately or store it in the refrigerator or freezer.
